column4: By failing, you mean it dies down sometime or it just doesn't work?
oh... it dosnt play any sound
Have you verified that all your sound out volume are up and none are muted?
yes
i tried to install alsa, but its already up to date
Hmmm. Have it worked ever before?
yes i got a new instal of ubuntu, but it has worked fine before
Have you tried verifying the levels from the CLI via alsamixer?
no. how do i do that?
Open the terminal and type alsamixer
how do i change the "MM" status?
pressing 'm' should toggle it.
got sound from my own mic now.
But still no sound from applications?
aye
I guess it's an application issue. What app are you using?
What does Tools -> Preferences -> Audio (In 'All' settings) have?
seems ok things are enabled
make that Tools -> Preferences -> Audio -> Output modules
Problem solved? :)
yes! thanks
